nodes.bodyText: This results in an eslint warning regarding the empty line between import statements + another one for the quotes.
All four eslint-disable-next-line no-undef comments are not necessary in for these cases.

We could structure this message similar to the dependency warning:
  • Removing the following owners will leave the entity ownerless:
    {pastOwners.map((owner, key) => ( {_cap(owner.type)} {owner.title} {key !== pasOwners.size - 1 && ', '} ))}
    • pastOwners is an array of Grantees in this case. This way the message is still readable, even if there are many previous owners, the owner names can be identified easier, because of the and it is consistent compared with the dependency warning.
.toJS() is not necessary in this case.
